title.narrative: SOCIETY VALUES POSITIVE DISCIPLINE TOWARDS CHILDREN

description.narrative: Society values positive discipline towards children, the child's right to live in a family environment and restorative justice., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those who are at risk, who are victims of violence, who are without parental care, and who are in contact and conflict with the law, benefit from a specialized legal, policy and institutional framework and have access to coordinated prevention and response services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Society values positive discipline towards children, the child?s right to live in a family environment and restorative justice.

description.narrative: Institutional violence against children remains a challenge both politically and protection-wise. Police violence against protesters (including children) and their disproportional use of force during the social unrest of 2019 has been a focus of UNICEF intervention with theOmbudsperson’s Office for Children. Indigenous children are impacted by the socio-political conflict in Araucania and UNICEF is monitoring the situation through local Ombudsperson representation. Violence against children under state protection has been addressed through the proposal of establishing a reparation roadmap. And violence perpetrated by caregivers has been evidenced through the generation of data about their knowledge, attitudes and practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

baseline.value: There is no information on the percentage of the population that values positive discipline

target.value: 2022: UNICEF generates a strategy of change for development in the area of prevention of violence against children and promotion of positive discipline

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF generates evidence on the percentage of the population that values positive discipline
